body.p: Roughly 7% of American males in U.S. have some sort of color blindness.
Suppose that a medical researcher selects one American male at random.

p.em: Let A represent the event ’the selected male is color blind’.
Let B represent the event ’the selected male is not color blind’.

body.p: Determine whether A and B are disjoint or independent.

response.name: disjoint
response.feedback: Correct. These events are disjoint because they cannot occur at the same time. An individual male cannot be both color blind and not color blind.

response.name: not disjoint
response.feedback: Incorrect. These events are disjoint because they cannot occur at the same time. An individual male cannot be both color blind and not color blind.

response.name: independent
response.feedback: Incorrect. The events are disjoint, so they cannot be independent. The occurrence (or not) of event A will affect the probability of B. If A occurs, the P(B) = 0. If A does not occur, then the P(B) = 1.

response.name: not independent
response.feedback: Correct. The events are disjoint, so they must be dependent. The occurrence (or not) of event A will affect the probability of B. If A occurs, the P(B) = 0. If A does not occur, then the P(B) = 1.
